timeline.message:
Add support for graph binary

Fixes #1564

Signed-off-by: Jan Jansen <jan.jansen@gdata.de>

timeline.bodyText: Please stay consistent here with the casing of janusgraph. I would use only lower case letters here as we also do it like that in the package name.
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,37 @@
+// Copyright 2020 JanusGraph Authors
+//
+// Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
+// you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
+// You may obtain a copy of the License at
+//
+//      http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+//
+// Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
+// distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
+// WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
+// See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
+// limitations under the License.
+
+package org.janusgraph.graphdb.tinkerpop.io.binary;
+
+public enum GraphBinaryType {
+    Geoshape(0x1000, "janusgraph.Geoshape"),
+    RelationIdentifier(0x1001, "janusGraph.RelationIdentifier"),

timeline.bodyText:
You copied this 1:1 from the TinkerPop sample, right?
This exception message however doesn't make much sense as you actually expect a custom_type_info, but one that is supported by the current type serializer.
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann

timeline.bodyText: The header should come before the imports.
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann

timeline.bodyText: (nitpick) I would prefer not to use random data in unit tests as it makes it slightly harder to debug in my opinion as I cannot see the expected values directly in the code. However, this is just my personal opinion. So, feel free to ignore it if you disagree.
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann

timeline.bodyText: Don't you think that it would be a good idea to test all geoshapes like this? I know that you didn't add any specific logic for the individual shapes, but I think we should make sure that everyone of them actually works.
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann

timeline.bodyText: (nitpick) I would use one test per shape as each test should only test one thing in my opinion. That makes it easier to spot directly what is not working if a test fails. If this test fails in assertPoint, we won't know whether geoshape serialization is broken completely or only for points.
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann

timeline.bodyText: I think it would be good to have some exception message explaining that an unsupported predicate name was used and that also includes that predicate name.
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann

timeline.bodyText:
Is the problem here that the serialization is not compatible with the current janusgraph/janusgraph:latest image from Docker Hub? Do you mean that with this note in the release notes?

GraphSON and Gryo Serialization has changed so both version need to be aligned

If this breaks serialization completely with all versions <0.6.0, then we definitely need a bigger warning in the release notes.
Apart from that, can't we fix this here by building the image directly during the build for these tests?
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann

replies.bodyText:
If this breaks serialization completely with all versions <0.6.0, then we definitely need a bigger warning in the release notes.

yes

Apart from that, can't we fix this here by building the image directly during the build for these tests?

Would be a good idea. I don't want to add this in the current PR.
replies.author: farodin91

replies.bodyText:
Would be a good idea. I don't want to add this in the current PR.

Makes sense. We should then only remember to activate this test again after the release of 0.6.0. Maybe we simply create a GitHub issue and tag it for 0.6.1 (which we can then resolve with a CTR commit as it only removes this line)?
replies.author: FlorianHockmann

timeline.bodyText: geoshape should have a more generic name, like predicate for example, as you also use this to test text predicates.
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann

timeline.bodyText: (nitpick) Please also change the variable name here.
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann

timeline.bodyText: (nitpick) Again, please change the name of relationIdentifier.
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann

timeline.bodyText:
Any reason not to simply change the serializer in remote.yaml? GraphBinary will replace Gryo in TinkerPop which is what we currently use in remote.yaml. I think that we should therefore also stop using that and make GraphBinary the new default.
Or do you want to wait a bit and then make this maybe the default in version 0.7.0?
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,17 @@
+# Copyright 2020 JanusGraph Authors

replies.bodyText: I think we shouldn't change this until we are able to manage a JanusGraph Server remotely without gryo.
replies.author: farodin91

replies.bodyText: Good point, I didn't think about that use case.
replies.author: FlorianHockmann

timeline.bodyText: gremlin-server-cql-es.yaml has been added on master and also needs the new serializer.
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann

timeline.bodyText: I think this should be: Serialization of JanusGraph predicates has changed
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -27,6 +27,54 @@ use the latest versions of the software.
 
 ## Release Notes
 
+### Version 0.6.0 (Release Date: X, 2020)
+
+```xml tab='Maven'
+<dependency>
+    <groupId>org.janusgraph</groupId>
+    <artifactId>janusgraph-core</artifactId>
+    <version>0.6.0</version>
+</dependency>
+```
+

+compile "org.janusgraph:janusgraph-core:0.6.0"
+```

+**Tested Compatibility:**

+* Apache Solr 7.0.0

+
+-   <https://github.com/JanusGraph/janusgraph/milestone/17?closed=1>
+
+#### Upgrade Instructions
+
+##### Serialization JanusGraphPredicates has changed

timeline.bodyText:
I commented on this already where you disabled a test that seems to be related to this, but this really needs some more explanation in my opinion to make it clear that serialization won't work between client and server if either is still on a version lower than 0.6.0 when the other is already updated to 0.6.0.
How about something like this:

The serialization of JanusGraph predicates has changed in this version for both GraphSON and Gryo. It is therefore necessary to update both the client and the server to this version in parallel as the server will not be able to deserialize a JanusGraph predicate that was serialized by a client prior to version 0.6.0 once it was updated to version 0.6.0.
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann

timeline.bodyText: checkout based on the driver <- What does that mean? What if I'm using janusgraph-driver?

replies.bodyText: What I meant here is how exactly GraphBinary can be used in the Java driver as you only explain the necessary changes on the server side.
replies.author: FlorianHockmann

timeline.bodyText:
I think we should add 1-2 sentences about what GraphBinary is in the first place as we cannot expect all users to follow development of TinkerPop. GraphBinary is a new feature we're introducing here to JanusGraph.
I suggest something like this:

GraphBinary is a new binary serialization format from TinkerPop that supersedes Gryo and it will eventually also replace GraphSON. GraphBinary is language independent and has a low serialization overhead which results in an improved performance.
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann

timeline.bodyText: That's really a nice way to test all these predicates :)
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann

timeline.bodyText: Not sure if this table adds much value. Just saying that this is currently only supported in our Java driver would be enough in my opinion (in addition with a short explanation / link how that can be configured). We don't have a Python driver yet, so I wouldn't even mention that here.
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -59,21 +59,37 @@ For more information on features and bug fixes in 0.6.0, see the GitHub mileston
 
 #### Upgrade Instructions
 
-##### Serialization JanusGraphPredicates has changed
+##### Serialization of JanusGraph predicates has changed
 
-GraphSON and Gryo Serialization has changed so both version need to be aligned.
+The serialization of JanusGraph predicates has changed in this version for both 
+GraphSON and Gryo. It is therefore necessary to update both the client and 
+the server to this version in parallel as the server will not be able to 
+deserialize a JanusGraph predicate that was serialized by a client prior 
+to version 0.6.0 once it was updated to version 0.6.0.
 
-##### GraphBinary is now support
+##### GraphBinary is now supported
 
-If you want to use GraphBinary, you have to add following to the `gremlin-server.yaml` after the keyword `serializers`. 
-This will added the support on the server site. For client site, you have to checkout based on the driver.
+[GraphBinary](http://tinkerpop.apache.org/docs/current/dev/io/#graphbinary) is a 
+new binary serialization format from TinkerPop that supersedes Gryo and it will 
+eventually also replace GraphSON. GraphBinary is language independent and has a 
+low serialization overhead which results in an improved performance.
+
+If you want to use GraphBinary, you have to add following to the `gremlin-server.yaml` 
+after the keyword `serializers`. This will add the support on the server site. 
 
 ```yaml
     - { className: org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.driver.ser.GraphBinaryMessageSerializerV1, 
         config: { ioRegistries: [org.janusgraph.graphdb.tinkerpop.JanusGraphIoRegistry] }}
     - { className: org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.driver.ser.GraphBinaryMessageSerializerV1, 
         config: { serializeResultToString: true }}
 ```
+JanusGraph Extensions for GraphBinary are currently supported by following clients:
+
+| Language | Version |
